files.desc:
FILES generates a process-file for a previously unprocessed file.
A process-file has the name '.process_<filename>', and the format:
{
'uuid': str, # Unique ID for this process-file
'path': str, # Full path to the file that is to be processed.
'found': int, # Timestamp of when process-file was first created.
'processing': int, # Timestamp set by FILE when sending path to a command, and also updated by command while processing.
'processed': int # Timestamp when processing is done and complete.
}.
In the configuration, a regex is used to associated a file with a feed. process-file is created in the same directory as the file being processed. Except, when the directory is read-only, in this case the configuration has a reference to a writable file system (see 'readonly') and that is where the process-file is created.
 Commands that consume the process-file shall also process the contents of the associated file that is found at the 'path'.  While the command is processing the contents of the file, it is periodically updating process-file with the current timesamp in the 'processing' field.
Periodically, FILES checks for hung processing. A hung process is when the 'processing' timestamp is more than 10 minutes old. It is assumed that hung processing shall not recover, and the process-file is recreated with a new UUID. If a hung processing should recover and resume processing the file, it will find a different UUID in the process-file, at which point it shall shutdown, stop processing the file, and make no changes to the process-file.
Periodically FILES checks for processing that has finished. Finished is when the 'processed' field is not zero. FILES has three choices at the finish:
1/ When read-only file sytems, the process-file continues to exist until something else removes the actual file; 2/ When archiving, the processed file is moved to the archive, and the process-file is removed; 3/ Otherwise, the processed file and process-file are erased.
files.eg: {p: { p:<path> d:1 ro:<path> fs:[ { f:<fileo> re:*\.csv } ] a:{ p:<path> dateSubDir:day purge:60 diskUsage:70 onError:<path> } } }

root.desc: Root name for the feed of file names.

path.desc: Path to load files from. Default is current directory.

depth.desc: Specifies the depth of subdir searching under input dir. Values are: no subdir(0); unlimited depth(-1); or, a depth(N)

readonly.desc: (readonly) is used when path (path) is read only. Touch-files are created to track prior processed files. (readonly) is a path on a writable file system where the touch-files can be created and deleted

feed.desc: Label the feed of file names. Use format to include root, {root}.name.

regex.desc: Regex string. For a single feed use '.*' to match all files

path.desc: Successful loading of the file is moved to this location

purge.desc: Age of archive file in seconds after which archived file is deleted

diskUsage.desc: Percentage usage of the file system where the archive is located, at or above this usage triggers the oldest archived files to be deleted

onError.desc: Failure to load whole or part of a file, this file is moved to this archive. Default is to delete the file that's in error when not readonly

loadf.eg: {files: <feed> f:<feed> fstats:<feed> s:{ tshark: false csv: 1 file:{ f: <feed> oracleTable: <table> csvRowCount: 1 } }

snapshot.desc: True when file contains a complete snapshot. Internally, this adds the snapshot indication to the feed, indicating the start and end of each snapshot. From a user's perspective, a join is paused until the first snapshot is received, subsequent snapshots are received peacemeal .

files.desc: Input feed containing the file-names that are loaded

feed.desc: Output feed containing the loaded data

fstats.desc: Output Feed containing stats about the loaded data

schema.desc: Define how to get the schema

tshark.desc: Process pcap files through tshark using -t json and use predefined procedures to clean up the tshark json.

csvHeaderRow.desc: CSV row count for files containing a CSV header row at the row count. Rows prior to the header row, are ignored and not processed as data nor headers.

file.desc: Schema is found in a separate file

feed.desc: Inputted file name(s) containing the schema

filetype.desc: Type of schema in the file

oracleTable.desc: When not default, schema is an Oracle formatted schema, and look for the schema labeled with the table-name

csvRowCount.desc: When gt 0, schema is csv formatted headers. This is the row count to the header row for this schema. Count starts at 1.

errors.desc: Output feed containing filename and error, for files that failed to load.

cleanup.desc: Instructions to cleanup the json that is outputted by parsing the data. These instructions are in addition to any automatic cleanup already performed by parsing

valuelabels.desc: name of file with a list of <blocklabel>,<keylabel>,<replacelabel>.

ignore.desc: name of file with a list of <label> to ignore

nest.desc: name of file with list of <label> to nest

trunc.desc: name of file with list of <label>, <value> to be truncated beyond value

logicalcondition.macro.desc: logical condition i.e. l:a o:eq r:{ f:b }

l.desc: left handside of the condition is a field name

logicalexpression.macro.desc: A nested expression, i.e. a eq 1 and b eq 2, l:{ c:{ l:a o:eq r:{ v:1 }} o:and c:{ c:{ l:b o:eq: r:{ v:2 }}}}

fieldwhere.macro.desc: Identification of fields and, can identify particular value. i.e. {f:fred, w:<expression>}

w.desc: Default is the empty expression; all values.

fieldpartition.macro.desc: Identification of fields and, may identify range of values. i.e. {f:fred, t:day}

loads.desc: Load a sum of field(s) identified explicitly by name or, the default is sum all number fields. Sum can be partitioned by field(s) from the same feed. { f:data i:datai fs:[ { f:<fieldwhere> } ] p:[ { f:<fieldPartition> w:<logicalExpression> } ] }

where.desc: restrict sum or, default is to sum all records

loadc.desc: Count occurence of values in field(s)

expand.desc: Add fields from values from within the same feed or from another feed. Two ways to join with the other feed. First is an explicit list of feed's fields. Second is by datatype, a list of datatypes identifies the feed's fields. { f:data j:{ fs:[ { f:<field> } ] } }

fields.desc: List of feeds to join on.

datatype.desc: Datatype with which to identify the field to join on. Alert when datatype is first obsolete in the feed. All fields with the datatype are expanded.

with.desc: Name of the other feed to join with, default is to join with itself

on.desc: List of fields to join on. If datatype, then one field expected in o.f. Otherwise for named fields, then o.f must match the number of names in fs.f

add.desc: {typefield}.name or fred.name. Where name is the new field

fmt.desc: {} style string format for new field. [] use python array slicing i.e. {}[1:3]. len({}) use python len to get the length of field.

alert.desc: Email sent to alert of system issues.

feed.desc: Name for the feed of alerts

input.desc: Flow of events that trigger the alert or, default is all errors

sumtype.desc: SUMPARTITIONED, one alert for each event; SUM, one alert for all events.

email.desc: Email a breakdown of files failed to load

period.desc: This is the period in second in between the email alerts.

routing.macro.desc: Routing indicator for Request and Indication messages as they traverse the Congregations: (true) heading upwards, towards the summit Congregation; (false) heading downwards, towards the next Congregation on the left; and, (null) heading upwards, towards the next Congregation on the right.

_ConReq_.desc: Congregation requests connection to another Congregation

cluster.desc: True when this ConReq is going toward the second Congregation in the cluster

resend.desc: Resend is present when the final destination is not reached, and ConReq needs to be resent to this address to continue on its journey.

cluster.desc: Congregation has been added to this cluster

Congregation.desc: Addresses of a Congregations in the cluster

_CongregationSizeReq_.desc: Request the number of the congregations on the left and right of the node

_CongregationSizeCfm_.desc: Number of congregations on the left and right of the node

_usageReq_.desc: Hallelujah requests host usage from Congregation.

_usageCfm_.desc: Congregation to Hallelujah, host usage response.

otherHosts.desc: List of other hosts that this Congregation is aware of.

cmdFilter.macro.desc: Sent from user to Hallelujah to find the first command in the database, or to Congregation to find the next command. Find by sheetUuid, cmdUuid, or feed.

feed.desc: Name of the feed served by the cmd

_cmdInd_.desc: Request commands running in the database

filters.desc: Filter used to select the command in cmdInd

cmdUuid.desc: The last cmd UUID received in cmdRsp.

_cmdRsp_.desc: Response from Congregation about the next command matching the criterior in cmdInd.

filters.desc: Filter used to select the command in cmdInd

cmd.desc: Cmd is optional, present when addressed has a command that matches the criterior

sheet.desc: Sheet is optional, present when addressed has the sheet that matches the criterior

Congregation.desc: Address of the Congregation where to send another cmdInd for the next command. Or, towards the summit for the first comInd

_schReq_.desc: Sent by user to Congregation to update the schema.

Congregation.desc: Address of the Congregation to re-send this request

_cmdReq_.desc: Sent by user to Congregation where the cmd is located to update a command.

oldcmd.desc: Old command, that is being updated

newcmd.desc: New command, {} to delete the command

Congregation.desc: Address of the Congregation to re-send this request

feedsInUse.desc: For error feed in use, the feeds being used are listed here.

_sheetReq_.desc: Sent from user to Congregation where the sheet is located to update a sheet.

Congregation.desc: Address of the Congregation where to resend the sheetReq towards the summit. Or, towards the congregation that will house this sheet.

_JahReq_.desc: Request to Congregation, from Hallelu, to create a Jah process

_JahCfm_.desc: Address of the Jah created from the _JahReq_

_streamReq_.desc: _streamReq_ is sent to Hallelu, from other Hallelu or User, to start a stream of data from the Hallelu's Jah. Same Message is forwarded to each Jah, to start stream processing which runs contineously building dataCfm messages so they are ready to be transmitted to the Receiver as soon _DatReq_.

streamUuid.desc: Unique ID for this stream request

burst.desc: Streams are synchronized, burst is the maximum number of documents to send before waiting for a dataCfm.

streamType.desc: Parallel is a Receiver for every Jah, and data is sent in parallel between Jahs and Receivers i.e. loadf _data_ to expand. ParallelDistribution has a Receiver for every Jah and must have distribution keys, the data is sent in parallel, and to not overload a Receiver it gets data from one Jah at a time i.e. loadf _data_ to expand with a join. Serial has one Receiver, there may be many Jah but one Jah at a time is sending _data_ to the Receiver i.e. loadf to an external Receiver like a GUI.

dataCols.desc: The default is to stream all columns. Otherwise, this is a list of columns to be streamed.

distribution.desc: The default is no distribution. Distribution divides the stream using the key columns. The key may be a complex type such as dict and list. The key is hashed, last bits of the hash selects the destination.

wildchar_masks.desc: Although Jah may have many masks per length of value, the stream command wants the first mask per length of value. this mask is applied before hashing

wildchar.desc: A single char that is the wildchar, i.e. X

mask.desc: Mask is 1 for hashable char and 0 for wildchar, i.e. 1101 matches value ABCD which is converted to the wildchar value of ABXD before hashing

_streamCfm_.desc: _streamCfm_ stop retransmit of _streamReq_. Contains the address of the Jah to be communicated with to get the stream's data. For parallel streams, there is a list of address for all jah, the receiver is expected to create a receiver for each Jah, and each receiver communicate with one of the Jah. For serial streams, there is one address entrypoint Jah. When sent from Jah, the list of jahs is not present.

_streamCanReq_.desc: _streamCan_ is sent to Hallelu, from other Hallelu or User, to stop a stream of data from the Hallelu's Jah. Same Message is forwarded to each Jah.

_streamTimeoutReq_.desc: _dataTimeoutReq_ is sent to a Hallelu, from other Hallelu or User, when the dataReq timeouts out to one of the Hallelu's Jah.

jah.desc: Jah that did not respond to dataReq.

_streamTimeoutCfm_.desc: _dataTimeoutCfm_ is sent back to Receiver, and indicates the replacement Jah.

nxtJah.desc: The address of the replacement Jah, may be the same Jah for temporary problems.

_dataReq_.desc: _dataReq_ is sent, from Hallelu or User, to a Jah.
